Transitivity properties of graphs
In this chapter we give functions used to investgiate various transitivity properties of graphs.
Given a graph \Gamma = (V,E), a function \phi:V\to V is an automorphism of \Gamma if it is a bijection such that for all v,w\in V, v,w are adjacent in \Gamma if and only if \phi(v),\phi(w) are adjacent in \Gamma.
